description.narrative: - Urban development: The Project will support the expansion of the city of Nairobi by addressing the need for additional residential housing and modern retail infrastructure in the suburbs along the new Thika highway. - Provision of modern retail infrastructure: The Project will provide a modern and innovative shopping centre expected to be the reference in Kenya and East Africa and also attract reputable international retailers to Kenya. - Access to property: The Project will provide Citizens with the opportunity to have access not only to modern residential units but also to improved quality of life as the Project will also develop a leisure park and recreational areas for families and children. - Job creation: The Project will create direct and indirect jobs both during and after project implementation. - Benefits to local suppliers: The Project will provide business opportunities to local subcontractors, property service companies and other suppliers of goods and services during and after project implementation. - Increased tax revenues: The Project will generate tax revenue to the Government of Kenya. - Development of the private sector: The Project will stimulate two key sectors of the economy, retail and property, with multiplier effects on other important segments of the economy (transport, food processing, banking/mortgage finance).

Garden City (The Project or GC) consists of a greenfield phased mixed-used development on 32.2 acre prime location in the outskirts of Nairobi (Kenya). The project will develop about 50,000sqm of lettable retail space, 421 residential units for sale and 3.4 acres of serviced land for sale. The Project is being developed by Actis Africa Real Estate Fund 2, (the Sponsor or ARE2) a fund managed by Actis LLP (Actis), a UK-based private equity firm focusing on emerging markets. The purpose of this investment is to help to address the need for residential housing and modern retail infrastructure in the fast growing eastern suburbs of Nairobi currently not served by any formalized retail. The Project implementation will be managed by Mentor Management in which Actis has an equity stake. Mentor Management is a reputable Kenya-based project management company with operations in East Africa.
